Key Match Events: Senga walked the bases loaded in the first inning and allowed two runs.
Another run scored after Senga walked the leadoff hitter in the second.
Ohtani delivered a two-run single in the second inning, ending Senga's outing.
Ohtani's explosive single off the fence in right-center that brought in a run after Marte misplayed the carom.
Betts delivered a three-run double in the eighth inning.
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets had hoped to get three innings from Senga, but were lucky to get three outs.
Senga cited mechanics as the root of his troubles.
Whether Senga will get another chance is unclear.

Post-Match Reflections: The Mets were non-competitive in a game for the first time this postseason.
The turnaround will be fast, with Game 2 scheduled for Monday afternoon.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ohtani was retired leading off the game for the Dodgers, but Senga walked Mookie Betts, Freddie Freeman and Teoscar Hernandez successively before retiring Will Smith for the second out.
Flaherty retired the next three batters.
Jose Butto loaded the bases in the eighth before Betts delivered a three-run double.
